description: From Old French suspect, from Latin suspectus, perfect passive participle of suspiciō (“mistrust, suspect”), from sub (“under”), + speciō (“watch, look at”).

adjectives.description: suspect (comparative more suspect, superlative most suspect)

examples: In his first book since the 2008 essay collection Natural Acts: A Sidelong View of Science and Nature, David Quammen looks at the natural world from yet another angle: the search for the next human pandemic, what epidemiologists call “the next big one.” His quest leads him around the world to study a variety of suspect zoonoses—animal-hosted pathogens that infect humans.
Now I’m suspect of other advice that I read in your pages.

entries.meaning: A person who is suspected of something, in particular of committing a crime.

verbs.description: suspect (third-person singular simple present suspects, present participle suspecting, simple past and past participle suspected)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To imagine or suppose (something) to be true, or to exist, without proof.
examples: to suspect the presence of disease

entries.meaning: (transitive) To distrust or have doubts about (something or someone).
examples: to suspect the truth of a story
I suspect him of being the thief.

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To look up to; to respect.
